resume.models

This module holds the models for the resume app.

class resume.models.CV_Category(*args, **kwargs)

CV_Category Model. Defines broad categories, under which each line of a CV can be displayed.

exception DoesNotExist
exception MultipleObjectsReturned
cv_categories = <django.db.models.manager.ManagerFromCV_Category_QuerySet object>

Accessor variable for the Project_QuerySet

name

Name of the category, used to organize cv_lines. Max length is 100.

priority

Priority decides the order in which cv_categories will be displayed. Lower number means higher priority. Different projects can have the same priority.

user_id

Stores user id as foreign key.

class resume.models.CV_Category_QuerySet(model=None, query=None, using=None, hints=None)

CV_Category_QuerySet. Provides functions for common queries on the CV_Cateogorys table.

get_categories_by_priority()

get_categories_by_priority() - Retrieves CV categories in order of priority

get_categories_by_priority_with_lines()

get_categories_by_priority_with_lines() - Retrieves CV categories in order of priority with associated cv_lines and sub_lines

class resume.models.CV_Line(*args, **kwargs)

CV_Line Model. A single line entry meant to go under a CV category

exception DoesNotExist
exception MultipleObjectsReturned
category

Category that the CV_Line belongs to. Foreign key to CV_Cateogory.name

cv_lines = <django.db.models.manager.ManagerFromCV_Line_QuerySet object>

Accessor variable for CV_Line_QuerySet.

end_date

Date the cv entry ended

entry

Entry of the cv_line displayed on the site. Max length is 300

start_date

Date the cv entry started

user_id

Stores user id as foreign key.

class resume.models.CV_Line_QuerySet(model=None, query=None, using=None, hints=None)

CV_Line_QuerySet. Provides functions for common queries on the CV_Lines table.

get_lines()

get_lines() - Retrieves CV lines

get_lines_by_start_date()

get_lines_by_start_date() - Retrieves CV lines in order of start_date, most recent first

get_lines_for_category(category)

get_lines_full_for_category(category) - Retrieves CV lines for a specified category

class resume.models.Page_Header(*args, **kwargs)

Created for Page headers. Currently only allows three page types: home, resume, and projects.

ALIGNMENT_CHOICES = (('L', 'Picture left aligned'), ('R', 'Picture right aligned'), ('C', 'Picture/text centered'))

Choices for the alignment of the header image

exception DoesNotExist
exception MultipleObjectsReturned
PAGE_CHOICES = (('Home', 'Home page'), ('Projects', 'Projects page'), ('Resume', 'Resume page'))

Choices for which page header is being edited

alignment

Chooses where the image will be shown. Limited to ASSIGNMENT_CHOICES

body

Body text that shows to the user when the header is assembled in html. Markdown enabled. Max length is 700.

image

Image that will be displayed with the header. Recommended aspect ratio is 7:5.

image_alt_text

Stores alt_text for the image, for accessibility purposes. Max length is 50.

name

Stores the page name of the header. Limited to PAGE_CHOICES: Home, Projects, Resume.

page_headers = <django.db.models.manager.ManagerFromPage_Header_QuerySet object>

The accessor for the Page_Header_QuerySet.

title

The heading that shows to the user when the header is assembled in html. Max length is 25.

user_id

Stores user id as foreign key.

class resume.models.Page_Header_QuerySet(model=None, query=None, using=None, hints=None)

Provides functions for common queries on the Page_Header table.

get_header_for_page(page_name)

Retrieves CV lines and their sub lines for a specified category

class resume.models.Project(*args, **kwargs)

Project Model. Basic information and things that can be used for list displays (like the image and short/long descriptions). Can be extended later with related table allowing a “detail” construction.

exception DoesNotExist
exception MultipleObjectsReturned
end_date

Date the project ended. Not required.

image

Image that will be displayed with the project. Recommended aspect ratio is 7:5

image_alt_text

Alt text for the image, used for accessibility purposes. Max length is 50.

long_description

Long description, used when view has more space (example: slide_layout). Max length is 600.

priority

Priority decides the order in which projects will be displayed. Lower number means higher priority. Different projects can have the same priority.

projects = <django.db.models.manager.ManagerFromProject_QuerySet object>

Accessor variable for the Project_QuerySet

short_description

Short description, used when view has less space (example: card_layout). Max length is 120.

start_date

Date the project started

title

Title of the project. Max length is 50.

url

Url that will direct to the project. Max length is 100. Not required.

url_title

Title that will be shown instead of the full url. Max length is 20. Not required.

user_id

Stores user id as foreign key.

class resume.models.Project_QuerySet(model=None, query=None, using=None, hints=None)

Project_QuerySet. Provides functions for common queries on the Projects table.

get_projects_by_priority(num_projects)

get_projects_by_priority(num_projects) - Retrieves up to the designated number of projects from the project model, with highest priority first.

get_projects_by_start_date(num_projects)

get_projects_by_start_date(num_projects): - Retrieves up to the designated number of projects from the project model, with most recent start date first
